title: Why Auxiliary Fields Matter: The Strange Case of the 4D, N = 1 Supersymmetric QCD Effective Action (II)
abstract: Within a four dimensional N = 1 superspace, we present a new ansatz for the Skyrme term and for the gauged WZNW term embedded into a superaction. We use the new chiral-nonminimal (CNM) formulation for the effective low-energy action of 4D, N = 1 supersymmetric QCD constructed by assigning right-handed components of Dirac fields to chiral multiplets and left-handed components of Dirac fields to nonminimal multiplets. It is noted that such a construction likely allows for a new type of parity violation in low-energy 4D, N = 1 supersymmetric QCD.
